'Tramlink' is a light rail system in south London, England. It began operation
in May 2000 as 'Croydon Tramlink', serving mainly the London Borough of
Croydon. It is operated by London Tramlink, an arm of Transport for
London (TfL).

Tramlink serves seven National Rail stations and has one interchange with the
London Underground, at Wimbledon for the District Line, and one with London
Overground, at West Croydon for the London Overground East London Line; one of
the factors leading to its creation was that the London Borough of Croydon has
no London Underground service.

Tramlink runs on a mixture of street track shared with other traffic, dedicated
track in public roads, and off-street track consisting of new rights-of-way,
former railway lines, and one section of alignment (not track) shared with a
third rail electrified Network Rail line.
categories: Light rail in the United Kingdom
Electric railways in the United Kingdom
